request.description:
OAuth scope: `client.read`

Retrieves the client identified by the `id` path parameter.

<Info>
  **Price plans:** this endpoint is available for all Qonto price plans
</Info>

response.name: Returns the client identified by the `id` path parameter.

request.description:
OAuth scope: `client.write`

Deletes the client identified by the `id` path parameter.

<Warning>
  **Important**: Client deletion is permanent and cannot be undone.
  Consider the following impacts before proceeding:

  - **Recurring invoices**: All recurring invoices associated with this client will be automatically canceled
  - **Historical invoices**: Previously issued invoices remain unchanged and will still display the client information
  - **API access**: Future API calls to retrieve this client by ID will return a 404 (Not Found) error
</Warning>

<Info>
  **Price plans:** this endpoint is available for all Qonto price plans
</Info>

query.description:
Clients can be filtered based on their `tax_identification_number`, `vat_number`, or `email`. The response will return exact and case-insensitive match(es).
Clients can also be filtered based on their `name`. The response will return exact and partial matches, case-insensitive and accent-insensitive match(es). When type is individual or freelancer, name consists of the concatenation of `first_name` & ‚Äù ‚Äù & `last_name`. The value must at least contain 2 characters minimum.
Returned page (cf. [Pagination](/get-started/general/pagination)).
Number of clients per page (cf. [Pagination](/get-started/general/pagination)).
Clients can be sorted by their `created_at` / `name` property in 2 possible orders: `asc` (Ascending) / `desc` (Descending).

request.description:
OAuth scope: `client.read`

Retrieves the list of clients for the authenticated organization.

You can filter (ex: only retrieve the latest clients) and sort this list by using [query parameters](#Query-Parameters) üëá

<Info>
  **Price plans:** this endpoint is available for all Qonto price plans.
</Info>

request.description:
OAuth scope: `client.write` Creates a single client for the authenticated organization. There is no uniqueness rule. It is strongly advised to search using the [GET /v2/clients](openapi_v2.yml/paths/~1v2~1clients/get) endpoint for a given client before creating a new client.
**Price plans:** this endpoint is available for all Qonto price plans.
